intro: Cryptangium parvulum, commonly known as the small cryptangium, is a rare and elusive plant species native to specific regions of southern Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody structure. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid conditions. Its flowering period is brief, often occurring in late spring or early summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Cryptangium parvulum is considered a vulnerable species in conservation efforts.
